revisions.rev:
{{primary sources|date=December 2010}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2010}} {{Infobox software | name = Orbit Downloader | logo = [[File:Orbit Downloader logo.png|border]] | screenshot = [[File:Orbit downloader screenshot.png|300px]] | caption = Screenshot of Orbit Downloader version 2 | developer = Innoshock | released = {{Start date|2006|11|8|df=yes}}<ref name="OrbitDownloaderHistory" /> | frequently updated = yes <!-- Release version update? Don't edit this page, just click on the version number! --> | operating system = [[Microsoft Windows]] | platform = [[IA-32]] | genre = [[Download manager]] | license = [[Adware]]<ref name="softpedia-adware" /> | website = {{URL|www.orbitdownloader.com}} }} '''Orbit Downloader''' is a [[download manager]] for [[Microsoft Windows]]. One of the main features of the program is its ability to grab and download embedded [[Flash Video]] files from sites like [[YouTube]], [[Dailymotion]], [[Metacafe]], etc.<ref name="features">{{cite web |url=http://www.orbitdownloader.com/features.htm |title=Features |work = OrbitDownloader.com |publisher = Innoshock |accessdate=4 February 2011 }}</ref> Orbit Downloader also accelerates downloads by acting as a peer-to-peer client, utilizing bandwidth of other users.
Orbit Downloader supports downloading from [[Hypertext Transfer Protocol|HTTP]], [[HTTP Secure|HTTPS]], [[File Transfer Protocol|FTP]], [[Metalink]], [[Real Time Streaming Protocol|RTSP]], [[Microsoft Media Server|MMS]] and [[Real Time Messaging Protocol|RTMP]] protocols. Orbit Downloader supports [[Internet Explorer]], [[Maxthon]], [[Mozilla Firefox]] and [[Opera (web browser)|Opera]] web browsers.<ref name="features" />
Orbit Downloader is an [[advertising-supported software|advertising-supported product]] since it may change the web browser's homepage upon installation and also offers to install software that are not critical for its operation.<ref name="softpedia-adware" />
==Bugs== Since version 4.0.0.10, the option to "Use server date/time for the downloaded file" does not work.<ref name="UseServerDateTimeNotWork" /> This means the downloaded files will not retain the last modified date/time from server. Instead, the downloaded files' date/time will be changed to the current date/time. As of version 4.1.0.1, the issue still remains. The last working version was 4.0.0.9.<ref name="UseServerDateTimeNotWork2" />
==See also== * [[Comparison of download managers]] * [[Real Time Messaging Protocol]]
==References== {{Reflist|refs= <ref name="OrbitDownloaderHistory">{{cite web |url=http://www.orbitdownloader.com/changelog.htm |title=Changelog |work =OrbitDownloader.com |publisher = Innoshock |date=16 April 2010 |accessdate=4 February 2011}}</ref> <ref name="softpedia-adware">{{Cite web |url = http://www.softpedia.com/get/Internet/Download-Managers/OrbitDownloader.shtml |title = Orbit Downloader 4.0.0.6 |work = [[Softpedia]] |publisher = SoftNews SRL |date = 13 January 2011 |accessdate=4 February 2011}}</ref> <ref name="UseServerDateTimeNotWork">{{Cite web |url = http://forum.orbitdownloader.com/viewtopic.php?pid=72454 |title = "Use server date/time" not working |work = forum.orbitdownloader.com |publisher = Forum Member garytpenang and emohedano |date = 4 April 2011 |accessdate=11 June 2011}}</ref> <ref name="UseServerDateTimeNotWork2">{{Cite web |url = http://forum.orbitdownloader.com/viewtopic.php?pid=73692 |title = Retaining of server date/time feature not working in 4.1.0.0 version |work = forum.orbitdownloader.com |publisher = Forum Members mindphaser and GaryM |date = 3 June 2011 |accessdate=11 June 2011}}</ref> }}
